meanings.definition: Drive or force (someone) to do something
meanings.sent1: The strong wind impelled the leaves to dance in the air.
meanings.sent2: The coach impelled the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of cookies impelled me to enter the bakery.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music impelled him to pursue a career as a musician.
meanings.sent5: The urgent message impelled her to take immediate action.

meanings.sent1: The inspiring speech impelled the audience to stand up and applaud.
meanings.sent2: The teacher impelled the students to complete their assignments on time.
meanings.sent3: The tempting aroma of freshly baked bread impelled him to buy a loaf.
meanings.sent4: Her determination impelled her to overcome all obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The emergency alarm impelled everyone to evacuate the building quickly.
